job_title: Total Rewards Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros:
Such a great place to work with competent, hardworking people at all levels, and an organization culture that really values diversity, inclusion and collaboration. As a relatively young non-profit organization it still has some work to do to be able to offer more competitive salaries at the entry-level, support and junior positions. However, it does offer competitive benefits, meaningful jobs and work opportunities and trainings. 

It has a young, multicultural and creative workforce that is connected to a global team in over 20 countries, which allows for an amazing learning opportunity in the development field.
cons: On the downside the organization tries to do a lot with few staff (due to funding constraints) which ends up disrupting at times the employees’ work-life balance. It also requires attention the salaries at entry-level and junior positions, and work-life balance. That said, I still think it’s a great place to work and it offers the right conditions for its employees to grow and succeed.

pros: Right To Play is an organization staffed by value-driven folks who are passionate about their work. It is a positive and supportive workplace where the ongoing learning, growth and safety of employees is a priority. There is a real drive to integrate the spirit of play into the important work that is done and this makes the experience of working at RTP more dynamic and fulfilling. I would recommend this organization to anyone interested in doing meaningful work that improves the lives of children and youth, being part of a dynamic team that is passionate about their work, and being challenged to learn grow as they contribute.
cons:
For a relatively small organization, the distance between senior level leadership and more junior employees can feel significant. 
As well, while the organization prioritizes employee learning and growth, the availability of internal staff positions that offer this growth does not keep up with the development of staff.
